TopicTitle: A Serious Mission: The Interstellar Voyage

Articles.Content:
Hello there KSP community, this is my first ever fan writing thing so bear with me. Note this was written at midnight, so expect there to be some mistakes that not even Word managed to catch. Please let me know if you find any!

Introduction

Jebediah Kerman, Eve, Year 40, Noon Eve time

Jeb almost fell out of his chair when the message came from command, probably a good thing he hadnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t considering EveÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s gravity. He couldnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t be reading it right, they were talking about a mission to Serious! Jeb was also quite surprised he wasnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t on this supposed mission. He then read the estimated mission time and quickly changed his mind: assuming no stops in SeriousÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ SOI, it could take longer than 16 years! Skimming through the news one other item caught his eye, the Laythe base was stranded in Jool orbit with almost no fuel left. Not very surprising considering some idiot at command had gone with a 4 decade old transfer engine design. Reaching the end of the news list, Jeb supposed he should get back to work, after all he only had one last thing to do. Using the last bit of the data allocated to him he transmitted a high frequency radio wave back to Kerbin containing the last image from the surface of Eve.

It wasnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t very high quality, but thatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s about as good as they could get it through EveÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s atmosphere [AuthorÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s note: In case you are wondering I ran the screen shot through some SSTV software with Robot 36 encoding]. Jebediah laid back in his chair and drifted off to sleep.

Desdas Kerman, KSC, Year 40, [Classified]

Desdas sat in the plane, they were retesting some old designs for speed and wanted to see how this one worked. As he throttled up the plane tipped over, spinning slightly on its wing. As mission control yelled franticly in the background he managed to right the plane as it went over the edge of the runway. He pulled up on the stick to try and avoid the rapidly approaching Astronaut complex. The plane moved, but in the wrong direction, slamming into the ground at high speeds. Desdas was ejected from the cockpit, scraping the top of the Astronaut Complex before slamming though the wall of the SPH and skidding to a stop on the metal floor.

Desdas Kerman, Alexander Klemming Memorial Hospital, Kerbin, Year 40, [Classified]

Desdas drifted between calm unconsciousness and agonizing awareness. He had broken 150 bones, received third and fourth degree burns when the plane exploded under him, lost 50% of his blood, received a concussion, had been impaled by a shard of metal, and to top it all off: acute radiation poisoning from when the reactor blew. Amazingly he survived these injuries thanks to the advanced medical technology at KSC and a recently discovered anti-radiation drug normally administered prior to Minmus trips. It would however take weeks to recover.

End of Chapter

So what did you guys think?
